description: A beautiful one-stop-shop dashboard to monitor ALL your Influx instances. Both Influx specific metrics, as well key OS metrics.

options.content:
### This dashboard aims to provide detailed visibility into the runtime stats for an InfluxDB instance using Influx's own metrics db - *_internal*, as well as a quick OS overview using *telegraf*. 

Simply chose the instance you want to monitor with the dropdown: "InfluxDB Metric Database". This dashboard also hosts all the **alerts** related to InfluxDB monitoring. 

> Please only add alerts to the row titled "Alerts", everything other than this row uses Grafana's Template variables in the panels, which does not support alerting.

alert.message:
CPU usage for InfluxDB host HIGH > 70% for 5m
Check if this is due to high IO Wait, if it is there may be too many http connections being made to influx for it to complete compactions in fast enough.

Duckduckgo
alert.name: InfluxDB CPU Usage alert

targets.query: SELECT 100-mean(usage_idle) as "used" FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" =~ /^$hostname$/ and cpu = 'cpu-total' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *

alert.message:
MEM usage for InfluxDB host HIGH > 60% for 5m
The host will eventually run out of MEM, and oom will kill influx.

Duckduckgo
alert.name: InfluxDB RAM usage alert

targets.query: SELECT last("used_percent") FROM "mem" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

alert.message:
DISK IO Read Time for InfluxDB host HIGH > 5s for 5m
Influx is probably having a hard time compacting. Shards may be exploding. You may need to drop a few shards, if this is not resolved soon.

Duckduckgo
alert.name: InfluxDB Disk I/O read time for /dev/sda alert

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_time),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /^$hostname$/ AND "name" =~ /nvme0n1$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *

panels.description: Displays the number of HTTP requests per minute.

targets.query: SELECT "queriesActive" FROM "monitor"."queryExecutor" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY "hostname"

panels.title: Active Queries

panels.description: Displays the duration, in nanoseconds, of the top 1% of HTTP WRITE requests.

targets.query:
SELECT non_negative_derivative(percentile("writeReqDurationNs", 99)) / non_negative_derivative(max("writeReq")) AS "Write Request"
FROM "monitor"."httpd" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($Interval), "hostname" fill(null)

panels.title: HTTP Write Request Duration (99th %)

panels.description: Displays the duration, in nanoseconds, of the top 1% of HTTP READ requests.

targets.query:
SELECT non_negative_derivative(percentile("queryReqDurationNs", 99)) / non_negative_derivative(max("queryReq")) AS "Query Request"
FROM "monitor"."httpd" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($Interval), "hostname" fill(null)

panels.title: HTTP Read Request Duration (99th %)

targets.query: SELECT last("uptime") AS "value" FROM "system" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval)
SELECT last("usage_idle") * -1 + 100 FROM "cpu" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hostname$/ AND "cpu" = 'cpu-total') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT last("used_percent") FROM "mem" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean("usage_iowait") FROM "cpu" WHERE ("host" =~ /^$hostname$/ AND "cpu" = 'cpu-total') AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval) fill(null)
SELECT mean(free) as free, mean(buffered) as buffered, mean(cached) as cached, mean(used) as used FROM "mem" WHERE host =~ /$hostname$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), host ORDER BY asc

SELECT mean(usage_user) as "user", mean(usage_system) as "system", mean(usage_softirq) as "softirq", mean(usage_steal) as "steal", mean(usage_nice) as "nice", mean(usage_irq) as "irq", mean(usage_iowait) as "iowait", mean(usage_guest) as "guest", mean(usage_guest_nice) as "guest_nice"  FROM "cpu" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ and cpu = 'cpu-total' AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_recv),1s)*8 as "in"  FROM "net" WHERE host =~ /$hostname/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(bytes_sent),1s)*8 as "out" FROM "net" WHERE host =~ /$hostname/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), * fill(none)

SELECT moving_average(mean("HeapSys"), 10) AS "heap sys", moving_average(mean("HeapInUse"), 10) AS "heap active", moving_average(mean("HeapIdle"), 10) AS "heap idle" FROM "monitor"."runtime" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "hostname" fill(none)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("PauseTotalNs"),1s) AS "mean_PauseTotalNs" FROM "monitor"."runtime" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($__interval), "hostname" fill(none)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(read_time),1s) as "read" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "name" =~ /nvme0n1$/  AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *
SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean(write_time),1s) as "write" FROM "diskio" WHERE "host" =~ /$hostname$/ AND "name" =~ /nvme0n1$/ AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), *

panels.description: Displays the number of HTTP requests per minute.

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(mean("queryReq"), 1m) FROM "monitor"."httpd" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($Interval), "hostname" fill(null)

panels.title: HTTP Requests / Minute

panels.description: Displays the number of HTTP errors per minute.
panels.title: HTTP Errors / Minute

panels.description: Displays the duration, in nanoseconds, of the top 1% of HTTP requests.

targets.query:
SELECT non_negative_derivative(percentile("writeReqDurationNs", 99)) / non_negative_derivative(max("writeReq")) AS "Write Request"
FROM "monitor"."httpd" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($Interval), "hostname" fill(null)

SELECT non_negative_derivative(percentile("queryReqDurationNs", 99)) / non_negative_derivative(max("queryReq")) AS "Query Request"
FROM "monitor"."httpd" WHERE ("hostname" =~ /^$hostname$/) AND $timeFilter GROUP BY time($Interval), "hostname" fill(null)

panels.title: HTTP Request Duration (99th %)

panels.description: Displays the number of measurements, by database.
panels.title: Number of Measurements by Database

panels.description: Displays the number of series (series cardinality) for the specified databases.
panels.title: Series Cardinality by Database

panels.description: Displays the number of shard write errors.
panels.title: Shard Write Errors

panels.description: Displays the non-negative mean rate of change in continuous queries (CQs) executed per minute.
panels.title: Continuous Queries Executed / Minute

panels.description: Displays the number of queries executed per minute.
panels.title: Queries Executed / Minute

panels.description: Displays the number of points requested each minute, by hostname.
panels.title: Point Throughput / Minute by Hostname

targets.query: SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("pointsWrittenFail"), 1m) FROM "httpd" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)
SELECT non_negative_derivative(last("pointsWrittenOK"), 1m) FROM "httpd" WHERE $timeFilter GROUP BY time($interval), "host" fill(null)

title: InfluxDB Overview
